instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1V
threads.message:
Came in with no power. Liquid damage around J9500 which I replaced. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is only 1V I have replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but still no change. I don’t really want to start throwing components at it.
It has orange light on magsafe.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages:
1- 0
2- 16.3
3- 4.3
9- 0
12- 3.4
13- 3.38
15- 0
17- 1
19- 5
20- 5
27- 1

L7130 – 0.16 diode
Is there anything else I can check?

threads.title: MacBook Air 820 00165 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1V
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"27- 1"
Be sure no short between <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and L7130.
Then change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
